meanings.definition: A person or business that lends money in exchange for personal property as security.
meanings.sent1: The pawnbroker accepted my old watch as collateral for the loan.
meanings.sent2: I went to the pawnbroker to borrow some money using my guitar as security.
meanings.sent3: The pawnbroker joked that he had more jewelry than a queen's treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, the pawnbroker is like a guardian of forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent5: The pawnbroker's shop was filled with all sorts of items waiting for redemption.

meanings.definition: To deposit personal property with a pawnbroker as security for a loan.
meanings.sent1: I had to pawnbroker my grandmother's ring to get some cash.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pawnbroker her old camera to pay for her bills.
meanings.sent3: As a last resort, he had to pawnbroker his favorite painting to make ends meet.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes life forces us to pawnbroker our memories for a chance at a better future.
meanings.sent5: The decision to pawnbroker her wedding ring weighed heavily on her heart.
